29.heading: Borla.

Next appearance of this feature is in in Man o' Mars #1 (1953).
Data from Lou Mougin via the Grand Comics Database Project.

notes: Summary: A man at the door asks Gladys personal questions, and she gets suspicious.

119.title: Born Loser
119.author: Art-Chip Sansom.
notes: Summary: Thornapple is chatting with an attractive female co-worker when Veeblefester walks by.

120.title: Born Loser
120.author: Sansom.
120.series: Aug. 1, 1990) "Might be a Good Idee, if'n I had Ten Times the Grass"*
notes: Summary: Brutus tells neighbor Hiram he should get a power mower, so he could cut ten times the grass in half the time.

121.title: Born Loser
121.author: Art-Chip Sansom.
121.series: Aug. 22, 1990) "No, No, Gladys! 'Bye, like in So Long!"*
notes: Summary: Gladys is going shopping.

122.title: Born Loser
122.author: Art-Chip Sansom.
notes: Summary: Brutus is impatient for his supper.

123.title: Born Loser
123.author: Art-Chip.
123.series: Sept. 27, 1990) "You Overlook the Ninth Green on the Golf Course!"*
notes: Summary: A realtor is showing a house as a ball comes through the window.

124.title: Born Loser
124.author: Art/Chip Sansom.
notes: Summary: Brutus calls the garçon to complain.

125.title: Born Loser
125.author: Art/Chip.
notes: Summary: Mother Gargle can't find her false teeth, and she was sure she left them where Brutus and the dog are sitting (and smiling)
Key words: Lost false teeth.

126.title: Born Loser
126.author: Art-Chip.
126.series: Dec. 25, 1991) "Can I Help It if We Had a Lot of Bills This Year?"*
notes: Summary: Gladys sings a list of home improvements to her mother on the telephone, to the tune of The Twelve Days of Christmas.

127.title: Born Loser
127.author: Art-Chip.
notes: Summary: To the left it's a hook, and to the right it's a slice, but what about down the middle?

128.title: Born Loser
128.author: Art/Chip.
notes: Summary: Brutus orders Cajun food, because he doesn't have a problem with ulcers.

129.title: Born Loser
129.author: Art-Chip.
129.series: June 9, 1992) "Do Try to Pick Up the Pace, It Looks Like Rain"*
notes: Summary: Brutus is the boss's guest for a round of golf, the cart is out of gas and Brutus is pushing it.

130.title: Born Loser
130.author: Art-Chip.
130.series: June 10, 1992) "What Have You Got for a Bad Case of Acne?"*
notes: Summary: The pharmacist's recommendation for making Gladys's skin youthful has worked.

131.title: Born Loser
131.author: Art - Chip.
notes: Summary: Brutus asks the waiter for a quiche.

132.title: Born Loser
132.author: Art-Chip.
132.series: July 10, 1992) "You Bought Golf Clubs and Everyone Knows You Can't Play Golf"*
notes: Summary: Gladys wants to buy a tennis bracelet, and Brutus thinks she must be kidding, she doesn't play tennis.

133.title: Born Loser
133.author: Art-Chip.
133.series: Aug. 7, 1992) "Whatever Would I Need to Wish For?"*
notes: Summary: Gladys blew out the candles, and since she already got a lawnmower for her birthday she didn't make a wish.

134.title: Born Loser
134.author: Art-Chip.
134.series: Sept. 9, 1992) "It Was His Big Idea to Housebreak Me"*
notes: Summary: Brutus is walking Kewpie in the rain, and Kewpie responds to his complaining.

135.title: Born Loser
135.author: Art-Chip.
135.series: June 10, 1993) "After I'm Gone It May Be Worth Something"*
notes: Summary: Brutus has finished painting a landscape, and tries to give it to Hurricane Hattie.

136.title: Born Loser
136.author: Art-Chip.
notes: Summary: Brutus is impressed with the boss's new car that has climate control.

137.title: Born Loser
137.author: Art-Chip.
137.series: Dec. 21, 1993) "That's a Lovely Idea, but I'm Afraid We Only Have a Piano"*
notes: Summary: The driver's license clerk asks Gladys if she'd consider being an organ donor.

138.title: Born Loser
138.author: Art/Chip.
notes: Summary: Brutus seems to be saying he knows something about Shakespeare, though Gladys say it took four years for him to make sophomore.

139.title: Born Loser
139.author: Art-Chip.
139.series: Feb. 8, 1995) "Just What Do You Make Anymore?"*
notes: Summary: Brutus wonders what Gladys does now that they have machines to make coffee, popcorn, pasta, and bread.

140.title: Born Loser
140.author: Art-Chip.
140.series: Sept. 2, 1995) "The Latest Technological Advancement in Graphite"*
notes: Summary: The boss has new golf clubs, and Brutus feels sorry for him, figuring wooden clubs like his are getting too expensive to make.

141.title: Born Loser
141.author: Art-Chip.
141.series: July 29, 1996) "I Splurged and Bought a New Golf Club"*
notes: Summary: The boss didn't buy a titanium and graphite one, he bought one with 18 holes and a clubhouse.

142.title: Born Loser
142.author: Art-Chip.
notes: Silent strip in which Brutus the birder uses his binoculars to look for a bird that is perched on his hat.

143.title: Born Loser
143.author: Art-Chip.
143.series: Jan. 18, 1997) "Bowl of Alfalfa Sprouts with a Glass of Salt Water"*
notes: Summary: Today's special is surf 'n' turf.

144.title: Born Loser
144.author: Art-Chip.
144.series: Feb. 20, 1997) "If You Were a Dachshund, You Would Be 315 Years Old!"*
notes: Suummary: Mother Gargle is down in the dumps about her birthday.

145.title: Born Loser
145.author: Art-Chip.
145.series: Apr. 16, 1997) "You're Right, I'd Better Take My Driver"*
notes: Summary: Brutus is going downstairs to check on a noise, and Gladys questions his taking his 9-iron with him.

146.title: Born Loser
146.author: Art-Chip.
146.series: May 3, 1997) "Respond Within Five Minutes Or You Will Be Disconnected"*
notes: Summary: Thornapple's television set times out while he's watching golf.

147.title: Born Loser
147.author: Art-Chip.
147.series: June 16, 1997) "Haven't They Been Extinct Since the Jurassic Period?"*
notes: Summary: The boss is going to see a periodontist.

148.title: Born Loser
148.author: Art/Chip.
notes: Summary: A letter from friends in England says they've visited Shakespeare's home.

149.title: Born Loser
149.author: Art-Chip.
notes: Key words: Shrimp, lobster, dinner, waiters, restaurants.

150.title: Born Loser
150.author: Art-Chip.
notes: Summary: Thornapple learns from his mistakes.

151.title: Born Loser
151.author: Art-Chip.
notes: Summary: Have patience, it has to ripen naturally.

152.title: Born Loser
152.author: Art-Chip.
152.series: July 31, 1997) "Tenth Anniversary of my Last Raise"*
notes: Key words: Champagne, celebrations, desks.

153.title: Born Loser
153.author: Art-Chip.
notes: Summary: Gladys is the only woman in his life.
Key words: Water coolers, marriage.

154.title: Born Loser
154.author: Art-Chip.
notes: Summary: E-mail has taught Brutus that he can't spell.

155.title: Born Loser
155.author: Art-Chip.
155.series: Aug. 16, 1997) "And His Wife's Got to Do Everything Else!"*
notes: Summary: Brutus has to entertain a client at golf; 'a man's got to do what a man's got to do!'

156.title: Born Loser
156.author: Art-Chip.
156.series: Nov. 1, 1997) "I'm Discouraged Enough As It Is!"*
notes: Summary: The golf pro wants Brutus to visualize each shot.

157.title: Born Loser
157.author: Art-Chip.
157.series: Dec. 29, 1997) "There's Sure an Impressive Amount of Wrapping"*
notes: Summary: Brutus is looking at the garbage can and thinking about the Christmas gifts.

158.title: Born Loser
158.author: Art-Chip.
158.series: Feb. 3, 1998) "Wilberforce Put Out Hot Cocoa For Them!"*
notes: Summary: Gladys is surprised at the enthusiasm of the birds at their bird feeder.

159.title: Born Loser
159.author: by Art & Chip Sansom.
notes: Summary: Gladys asks Brutus to keep his mind off golf until they finish dinner.

160.title: Born Loser
160.author: [No author]
160.series: May 4, 1998) "If It Wasn't for the Crab Grass We Wouldn't Have Any Green At All!"*
notes: Summary: Brutus and Gladys look out the window at their lawn.

161.title: Born Loser
161.author: Art-Chip.
161.series: June 3, 1998) "The French Name for a Gentleman"*
notes: Summary: Brutus explains the difference between a hurricane and a monsoon.

162.title: Born Loser
162.author: Art-Chip.
notes: Summary: Brutus commands Kewpie to sit, and Kewpie climbs up in his lap.

163.title: Born Loser
163.author: Art-Chip.
163.series: Aug. 29, 1998) "He Doesn't Bark at Strangers, Gladys, He Only Barks at Me"*
notes: Summary: Kewpie won't stop barking, and Gladys thinks he'll keep intruders away.

164.title: Born Loser
164.author: Chip Sansom.
notes: Summary: Wilberforce is in trouble for taking a bunch of divots.

165.title: Born Loser
165.author: Art-Chip.
165.series: Mar. 9, 1999) "Aren't You the Person who thought a Subwoofer was a Small Dog?"*
notes: Summary: Gladys and Brutus are shopping for a sound system.

166.title: Born Loser
166.author: Art-Chip.
166.series: Apr. 6, 1999) "Instead of Hooking Your Ball into the Next Fairway, You Hook It Two Fairways Over!"*
notes: Summary: Brutus likes his new jumbo driver.

167.title: Born Loser
167.author: Art Sansom & Chip Sansom.
167.series: Apr. 29, 1999) "Anyone Who Thinks Computers are Only for the Intelligent"*
notes: Summary: Brutus is in a chat room.

168.title: Born Loser
168.author: Art Sansom & Chip Sansom.
168.series: June 12, 1999) "A Trendy New Feel Good Diet Every Week"*
notes: Summary: Gladys is waiting for a sweets diet.

169.title: Born Loser
169.author: Art-Chip.
notes: Summary: Brutus knows that Summer vacation is here.

170.title: Born Loser
170.author: Art-Chip.
170.series: July 1, 1999) "You Just Never Change Into Anything"*
notes: Summary: Brutus wonders if Gladys still thinks of him as her Clark Kent.

171.title: Born Loser
171.author: Art Sansom & Chip Sansom.
171.series: July 10, 1999) "Nothing is So Bad That It Couldn't Be Worse!"*
notes: Summary: Brutus is not comforted.
Call no: PN6726 f.B55 "discouraged"

172.title: Born Loser
172.author: Art Sansom & Chip Sansom.
notes: Summary: Brutus pours a whole pot of coffee into his cup.

173.title: Born Loser
173.author: Art-Chip.
173.series: July 26, 1999) "May I Have My Umbrella Back?"*
notes: Summary: It's raining at the bus stop, and Veeblefester's bus arrives; a soaked Thornapple has to ask for his umbrella back.

174.title: Born Loser
174.author: Art-Chip.
174.series: Sept. 2, 1999) "My Life is an Open Book!"*
notes: Summary: Gladys agrees with Brutus, but she thinks the book is a comic book.

175.title: Born Loser
175.author: Art-Chip.
175.series: Nov. 6, 1999) "It Is The Way I Play It"*
notes: Summary: Brutus says he uses a golf cart because golf is tiring, and Hattie disagrees.

176.title: Born Loser
176.author: Art-Chip.
176.series: May 1, 2000) "When I Turned My Putter In, They Gave Me a Voucher for a Free Game!"*
notes: Summary: Thornapple impresses the boss by saying he got a hole in one.

177.title: Born Loser
177.author: by Art & Chip Sansom.
177.series: June 13, 2000) "So Many Channels, So Little Time!"*
notes: Summary: Brutus likes his new satellite dish.

178.title: Born Loser
178.author: by Art & Chip Sansom.
178.series: July 3, 2000) "If This Were That Survivor Show, I'd Vote You Off the Island!"*
notes: Summary: Gladys insists that Brutus mow the lawn, no procrastinating.

179.title: Born Loser
179.author: Art-Chip.
179.series: July 5, 2000) "What Goes with a Cheeseburger and Fries?"*
notes: Summary: The waiter asks if he may recommend a wine.

180.title: Born Loser
180.author: Art Sansom & Chip Sansom.
180.series: July 31, 2000) "I Just Hate What It Does To My Hair"*

181.title: Born Loser
181.author: Art-Chip.
181.series: Aug. 8, 2000) "My Eyes are Bigger than my Stomach"*
notes: Summary: Brutus decides not to look at the dessert tray.

182.title: Born Loser
182.author: Art/Chip.
182.series: Aug. 24, 2000) "If I Pull Up the Weeds, There Won't Be Any Green Left in the Lawn at All!"*
notes: Summary: Gladys wants something done about the weeds in the lawn.

183.title: Born Loser
183.author: Art-Chip.
183.series: Oct. 3, 2000) "Your Share of the Check Comes to $17.50"*
notes: Summary: Brutus thought he was being taken out to lunch.

184.title: Born Loser
184.author: Art-Chip.
184.series: Dec. 1, 2000) "This Meatloaf Tastes a Little Funny to Me!"*

185.title: Born Loser
185.author: Art-Chip.
185.series: Dec. 25, 2000) "He Just Ripped Through It All in Two Minutes and Fifteen Seconds"*
notes: Summary: Wilberforce has unwrapped the presents it took his parents hours to wrap.

186.title: Born Loser
186.author: Art-Chip.
186.series: June 23, 2001) "Playing the Wrong Game at the Wrong Time"*
notes: Summary: Brutus's bowling score would be a good golf score, and vice versa.

187.title: Born Loser
187.author: Art-Chip.
187.series: Oct. 10, 2001) "Is This Cola You Poured For Me Diet or Regular?"*
notes: Summary: Brutus can't tell the difference.

188.title: Born Loser
188.author: Art-Chip.
188.series: June 11, 2002) "Is It Too Early to Say, Wait Till Next Year?"*
notes: They've played the first game of the season. Brutus is standing with a push mower.

189.title: Born Loser
189.author: Art-Chip.
189.series: June 13, 2002) "He Was Fired Because He Had Too Many Half-Baked Ideas"*
notes: Summary: Chef Bruno no longer works at the restaurant.

190.title: Born Loser
190.author: Art & Chip.
notes: Summary: The card says to try again.

191.title: Born Loser
191.author: Art-Chip.
191.series: Oct. 8, 2004) "He Says it's So Old it Only Broadcasts in Black and White!"*
notes: Summary: Brutus has found an antique radio.

205.heading: Born Losers.
205.title: "Escape to Eternity"
205.author: McCarthy & Zakarin
notes: (A True "He-Man" Adventure)

Summary: Joe Tucker, an unemployed pilot, takes a job flying Korak, a Red spy, out of the country. Korak then tries to kill Joe, but Korak's other prisoner Erica has a gun and saves the day. "You Commies are born losers," says Joe.

206.title: The Born Loser's Guide to Life
206.author: Art & Chip Sansom.

207.heading: Born Lucky.
207.title: "Some People are Born Lucky"
207.author: Smythe.
notes: Summary: Andy complains that Flo's on the go all day and doesn't have time to get bored.
